title: So you’re probably wondering how I got to this post…
text:
First of all, welcome! This is my big break into the blogosphere, so you’re getting in on the ground floor. How exciting!
This is my place to get thoughts on the page, primarily in the realms of energy systems and data science. It’s also a place to showcase the skills I’ve sharpened as a professional, and mess around with tools I’d like to add to my toolset.
This is also a place to start paying forward the knowledge sharing I benefited from at NMR Group, where I cut my teeth as an analyst, data scientist, and eventually as a mentor to folks starting their professional journeys in R and/or in data science.

title: Who am I?
text:
I’m many things: data scientist, environmental engineer, son, brother, Brooklynite, runner, and trivia enthusiast.
Professionally, I’m a multi-lingual analyst with domain expertise in energy efficiency, data science, and program evaluation. I have consulted for energy & utilities clients, written peer-reviewed papers, and helped to grow analysis teams using R & Python. My specialties are understanding complex systems, developing reproducible models, turning results into actionable findings, and mentoring data scientists.
My academic background is in physics, environmental engineering, and Spanish. Outside of coursework, I have also learned how to be a skilled educator.
